titles.title: Prohibition of Cigarette Sales to Minors in Federal Buildings and Lands Act

To limit access by minors to cigarettes through prohibiting the sale of tobacco products in vending machines and the distribution of free samples of tobacco products in Federal buildings and property accessible by minors.

bill.summary: 2/10/1994--Introduced. Prohibition of Cigarette Sales to Minors in Federal Buildings and Lands Act - Requires the Administrator of the General Services Administration and the head of each Federal agency to promulgate regulations that prohibit the sale of tobacco products in vending machines and the distribution of free samples of tobacco products in or around any Federal building under their jurisdiction. Sets forth similar requirements pertaining to the Capitol Buildings and grounds.
